I think the most accurate answer here is **"Zombies can die many times."** 

The classic portrayal of zombies in fiction is that they are reanimated corpses, driven by a primal urge to feed.  They can be destroyed repeatedly through various means (shooting, decapitation, fire, etc.), yet they often rise again.  

While some of the other options might have metaphorical interpretations, they don't hold up to the literal meaning of "dying many times."
